Posts.Content: RLS2713 wrote: Hi, This is my second post since I've discovered this board, my last post was pending results from my biopsy. Got the call yesterday, that all the three areas tested positive for breast cancer.  Invasive ductal carsinoma. I feel like I am in a dream.  I am 31 yrs old and have a 13 month old.   Now, I have to wait until Monday to start all my calls and schedule appts.  I am now more scared of my full body scans, to see if it is anywhere else in my body. I am so fortunate that  I have a very good friend who is an oncology nurse who is helping get set up with all right people. I don't think it has sunk in yet.  The worst was having to tell my husband and my parents. I guess it will become real on Monday. I just want to be there to see my son grow up.  Is it even possible to have more kids?  Probably not, I am just so lucky that I have one.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed RLS2713 LaurelS

Posts.Content: RLS2713 wrote: Hi, I just came across this site and was reading some of the posts.  I am 31 and found a lump in my breast last Sunday. Everything moved quickly, I was seen by my doctor, then scheduled for an ultrasound and mammogram.  The radiologist scheduled me for a biopsy for Wed morning.  My gyn called today and said the doctor is concerned. I am so scared for my son, he's not even two.  I want to have more kids.   From what I read, not knowing is the worst, once I know, then I can start my plan. So nice to know there is a board out there with so many women on your side.  I can't get over thinking how unfair this is to happen to so many of us!!  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Scheduled for a biopsy RLS2713 Makratz

Posts.Content: Nov 1, 2008 10:20AM RLS2713 wrote: Thank you so much for your support.  This is so nice to know this is out here with so many women going through the same thing. Thank you for replying, it's nice to know there are people out there like you!
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed RLS2713 LaurelS
